attributes.action: Have a meaningful vote on Parliamentary Petitions after a debate
attributes.background: Currently petitions from this website have no legislative effect, they are merely debated and then left in the dust. To be a more transparent democracy this should be changed such that these public parliamentary petitions may be formed into motions and potentially into law.
attributes.additional_details:
In my eyes an ideal system would be to have these petitions firstly carry on as they are; proceeding to go to debate if they hit 100,000 signatories, have the non-binding debate in parliament as is at the moment and THEN, after that debate, have all present Commons MPs vote on forming the petition into an official parliamentary motion that is then brought to the Commons Chamber.

This will create for a more direct and transparent democracy which I would hope for the government to support.

attributes.action: Have all children educated in co-ed, non-faith schools.
attributes.background: Damian Hinds is expanding faith schools. Instead of breaking down barriers & encouraging a harmonious, co-ed, non-faith education system for ALL (like the real world), he is creating more barriers. We need respect, understanding & tolerance whether religious on non-religious.SAY NO TO FAITH SCHOOLS.

attributes.action: Change the burden of proof threshold in Police 'Gross Misconduct' hearings.
attributes.background: Currently in Police 'Gross Misconduct' proceedings the level of proof required is based on the 'balance of probability', being the evidential test applied in civil court cases, this is both unfair and against the principles of fair and natural justice.
attributes.additional_details: Fairness and justice demands the burden of proof that need be met be no less than that required in criminal cases, 'beyond all reasonable doubt'. Possible outcomes in 'Gross Misconduct' cases are the loss of a persons livelihood, barring them working in the police service in any capacity, them being named on a public register, along with the loss of reputation and risk of disadvantaging them in obtaining alternative employment. Only meeting the highest evidential threshold can justify this.

attributes.action: Stop anyone paid from the public purse being paid more than the prime minister
attributes.background: We pay the prime minister around £150k to run the country so it is both illogical and unfair to pay a council CE £160k or more for running a small budget operation with zero competition. We do not need to compete in the open market for those good enough to perform in non competitive sectors
attributes.additional_details: The public sector is not in competition with anyone. Your local council will not be beaten by a competitor so why do we need to pay premium salaries for managerial staff. The BBC is funded by a tax in the form of licence fee so why do we need to at newsreaders £400k plus to read the news. They are not attracting advertising and it is perfectly possible to keep promoting younger journalists if they leave. The same is true for all publicly funded or supported jobs.

attributes.action: We call for a total ban of all alcohol and tobacco based products in the UK
attributes.background:
There is a substantial body of scientific and medical evidence to show that legalized drugs, primarily as alcohol and tobacco, are harmful and can damage people’s mental and physical health, and our wider communities.

We call for the government to ban these harmful substances.
attributes.additional_details:
We believe that the legalization of Alcohol and Tobacco send the wrong message to the vast majority of people who do not take drugs, especially the young and vulnerable, and leads to widespread misuse of these drugs.

These drugs are extremely harmful to individuals and communities, and should be banned, especially as they are significantly more harmful than already illegal drugs such as Cannabis.

http://www.thelancet.com/journals/lancet/article/PIIS0140-6736%2807%2960464-4/fulltext

attributes.action: Make the teaching of sexual consent compulsory in schools and universities
attributes.background: At a UK university, students were suspended for a group chat containing jokes about rape, racism and violence; it has highlighted how prevalent rape culture is within our society. Students should be taught about these issues in order to make the school and university environment a lot safer.
attributes.additional_details: Still in 2018, people do not know what consent is, as a lot of actions come under the umbrella of 'sexual harassment'. People think they know what consent is but we must be reminded about the complexities of it. We must protect the most vulnerable in society and this is the perfect way to start. Students should be taught about these issues in order to prevent something like this happening again.

attributes.action: Alter service criteria to allow Bulimia Nervosa patients better treatment access
attributes.background: Eating Disorder services across the U.K use BMI and daily bingeing / purging criteria to assess access to treatment for Bulimia Nervosa sufferers. If the specific criteria is not met, sufferers are refused treatment. This perpetuates the disorder and leads to crisis situations.
attributes.additional_details:
Most sufferers of Bulimia Nervosa have chaotic eating habits and often seek help when actively attempting to interrupt their own symptoms. This can affect their ability to meet the 'daily bingeing / purging' criterion. BMI is also often arbitrary in cases of BN as fluctuations in weight are massive and weight is extremely unstable. 

Services should take a more holistic approach when assessing an individual, and the inappropriate criteria should be altered or removed entirely from the process.

attributes.action: Increase maternity pay and support for working families
attributes.background: Maternity pay for working parents is ridiculous. £140 a week or less is not enough to support a child! This amount needs to be increased to take the pressure away from working families.
attributes.additional_details: There is no support for working families like there is for unemployed/low income families (sure start maternity grant.) more support is desperately needed. Minimum maternity also needs to be increased, and £140 a week made the minimum amount. This is putting a huge amount of mental strain on new families and something needs to be done.

attributes.action: Statutory periodic vision screening for all drivers during their driving life
attributes.background: The UK regulations are amongst the weakest in Europe relying on self-regulation and reporting. Road safety should start with good vision and current procedures lack any medical rigour to substantiate visual fitness to drive increasing the potential for injury or death due to accidents.
attributes.additional_details:
WHO declared poor vision is one of the main risk factors for crashes.

A 2014 Brake study showed 1.5 million UK drivers have never had an eye test.

Visit www.drivingblind.org.uk to rally support.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory to declare allergenic ingredients in alcoholic distillates
attributes.background: By law, allergens on ingredients lists must be highlighted by means including bold type, italics, underlining - anything that emphasises the presence of 1 of the 14 allergens. Alcoholic distillates are exempt from this law and do not have to declare the allergenic ingredients - a danger to many.
attributes.additional_details: I bought my boyfriend some chocolates for Valentine's from a well-known chocolate shop. He has a severe nut allergy and has been hospitalised before. I checked the ingredients many times and asked staff to check - nuts weren't listed as an allergen. On opening the chocolates, one contained hazelnut liqueur - which by law doesn't have to be declared as an allergen. This is dangerous, and could have killed my boyfriend. Action needs to be taken so derived products also have to declare allergens.

attributes.action: Mandatory CCTV in schools and nurseries!
attributes.background:
We have CCTV on buses , trains , shops for our own safety but no mandatory cctv in schools and nurseries for our children's safety. 

It will help parents know their kids are safe.
It will help prevent any type of children abuse.
It will help nursery management to review any accidents if needed.

attributes.action: Add a higher tax rate to Aspartame sweetener.
attributes.background: Aspartame effects many illnesses. Not just Pku. The over use of aspartame is denying people with these illnesses freedom of choice. Perhaps a higher tax added to Aspartame to encourage the use of natural sweeteners is now appropriate so people with illnesses have freedom of choice again

attributes.action: Increased funding for the police for dealing with anti-social behaviour.
attributes.background: As part of my Active Citizenship coursework I am taking action in my local area to reduce crime and make it a safer place.

attributes.action: Stop motorway closures at night
attributes.background: I am asking for signatures to stop the closure of England's major roads at night. These closures are costing companies incredible amounts of fuel and drivers’ tachos, hours. As a night HGV driver I have to navigate a huge truck many miles off route facing the horror of bad or no detour signage.

attributes.action: Make the referral process for SPD easier and raise awareness of the condition
attributes.background: Sensory Processing Disorder affects many children, who are struggling to carry out everyday tasks, which affects their wellbeing and education, parents are living with an everyday battle, and without help and support this is an overwhelming task, which is detrimental to the health of the parents.
attributes.additional_details: Many of these parents spend years getting endless declined referrals, and having to be persistent in finding other professionals to help, during this time a small person is left suffering and a family is left struggling, education is being affected, and these children are seen as naughty and disruptive. If a parent was seen to be leaving a child suffering, Social Services would intervene, yet many parents are begging for help to stop their child suffering, and are being ignored.

attributes.action: Make menstrual cups available for free to homeless and low-income women.
attributes.background: Giving reusable menstrual products to homeless and low-income women will allow them to focus their money on basic needs e.g food and shelter, and protect women who can't afford period products monthly from diseases related to poor menstrual hygeine.
attributes.additional_details:
Menstrual cups typically cost £7.99-£20 pounds, depending on brand, and can last up to 10 years.

In 10 years the average woman would spend £240-£960 on tampons, and those with heavier or longer periods could spend much more. 

(Given that tampons tend to cost 10p-40p each and the average woman will use around 240 per year a women with an average length/flow of period will spend between £24.00 and £96.00 per year on tampons.)

attributes.action: Student Finance made available for part time Paramedic degree
attributes.background:
We need the decision made by Student Finance England to not recognise the part time Paramedic BSc degree course we are in overturned. 
The course is delivered in partnership between Outreach Medical Services (ORMS) & The Robert Gordon University in Aberdeen
attributes.additional_details:
we have had positive, supportive responses from many people and although they agree that there should be support for paramedics We have received this response from student finance England 
“I have had a look at the courses Outreach Rescue provide and they would not be considered designated courses in relation to The Education (Student Support) Regulations 2011
 Also, the 3rd party company (Outreach Rescue) are not a franchise of your university.”

Please help us get this decision overturned

attributes.action: Abolish Leasehold
attributes.background: Leasehold is a completely outdated law and should be abolished. Freeholders charge exorbitant amount for annual service charge and at the time of lease renewal. It is so inhumane that you spend your hard earned money and still treated as a tenant.

attributes.action: Call for the government to re-form the RNXS and recruit members
attributes.background: UK Border Force and the Home office is currently considering the potential benefits of a Border Force Special Volunteer force,
attributes.additional_details:
Perhaps they have forgotten we use to have a service that was perfectly suited to that role  

The Royal Naval Auxiliary Service (R.N.X.S) was a uniformed, unarmed, civilian volunteer service, administered and trained by the Royal Navy to operate in the ports and anchorages of the UK
It maintained training units, and vessels at most major ports in the UK. and was formed in 1963 The service was disbanded on 31 March 1994 Back when  the nuclear threat was not as serious as it has become today.

This along with the new threats ,of terrorism,illegal immigration or borders are in crises.https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Royal_Naval_Auxiliary_Service 

It is time to resurrect the RNXS

attributes.action: Campaign to shelter the homeless during any night reaching sub-zero temperatures
attributes.background:
There is currently no legal protection for the homeless during severe weather - the provision of shelter (SWEP) is not a statutory duty even when conditions are life threatening

Make it a legal obligation for local authorities to provide shelter to all rough sleepers during severe weather.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.homeless.org.uk/our-work/resources/guidance-on-severe-weather-emergency-protocol-swep-and-extended-weather-provision

attributes.action: Improve mental health education in schools & make offering counselling required
attributes.background: The teaching of mental health becoming required was a huge step, but there’s a long way to go until support and info on mental health within schools is enough. Having anxiety and depression myself, I know that many people can be left alone or confused; it shouldn’t be seen as a minor topic to rush.
attributes.additional_details:
Counselling in schools should be offered and easy to access, eg if students were provided with questionnaires on their mental well-being once every few months, their mental state could be easily monitored and be offered support and extra info if needed.
- Around 850,000 5-16 yr olds suffer with mental illness (almost 1 in 10 / 3 per class)
-70% increase in self harm rates in 10-14 yr olds over past 2 years
-70% of young people with a mental illness don't get the appropriate support

attributes.action: Grant free prescriptions to Auto-Immune Hepatitis sufferers
attributes.background: Some chronic auto-immune conditions (such as type 1 diabetes) qualify for free NHS prescriptions. Other auto-immune conditions (such as auto-immune hepatitis), which equally require life-long prescription drugs, do not. This petition seeks to ensure equality for such conditions.

attributes.action: Ban companies from including cheap plastic toys in children’s magazines.
attributes.background:
All children’s magazines on sale in UK shops have a packet of cheap plastic tat attached to them as a purchase incentive. 

This is catastrophic for the environment. But it also creates negative behaviour in children - they should desire magazines for reading/activities not gaining more stuff.
attributes.additional_details: Cheap, disposable tat that is given for free in magazines, has no longevity and will end up in landfill before the year is out most likely. If children’s magazines alone were not permitted to include this stuff, think of the difference this would make - not only on the environment but also kids’ attitudes to reading magazines for the love of reading, alone!

attributes.action: All children aged 16 to 19 in further education should be entitled to EMA
attributes.background: I am a mother to 4 children. Not all my children are entitled to EMA because we earn too much. Why should our children be penalised by the Government when EMA is for the child and not the parent? It unfair for all children in further education.
attributes.additional_details: Without EMA children like mine don’t have the money to do what their peers do. I have also spoken to other parents who feel the same way as I do and feel that our children are being penalised by the government.

attributes.action: Ban supermarkets from selling helium canisters.
attributes.background: On the 25th of January I lost my dad suddenly to suicide by a helium gas canister. The canister was purchased from a supermarket making it easy to obtain and go through with, without any detection of what he was about to do.
attributes.additional_details:
Helium works so quickly, it doesn’t give you time to think about what you are doing because you lose consciousness within a minute.
If you think of the restrictions they have on paracetamol, it’s crazy there aren’t more on this even more dangerous substance.

attributes.action: Ban the delivery of charity collection bags to households in the UK
attributes.background: Large plastic charity bags, wrapped in plastic envelopes, are delivered to thousands of households in the UK every week. Only a tiny percentage are filled for collection with the majority ending up straight in the homeowner’s bin and off to landfill. This unnecessary use of plastic bags must stop.
attributes.additional_details:
Large plastic charity bags, wrapped in plastic envelopes, are delivered to thousands of households in the UK every week. Only a tiny percentage are filled for collection with the majority ending up straight in the homeowner’s bin and off to landfill. This unnecessary use of plastic bags must stop.

It is believed that 500,000 plastic charity collection bags are sent to landfill every year. Each bag is delivered inside another plastic bag envelope, so about one million bags are disposed of every year. 

Charities rely on the donation of goods. Unwanted goods can be taken to local charity shops or conveniently located collection points. 

If you agree, please sign and share.

attributes.action: Ban the culinary practice of boiling lobsters while still alive and conscious.
attributes.background:
The Swiss government is banning the culinary practice of boiling lobsters while they are still conscious.

This is in response to studies that suggest lobsters have advanced nervous systems and feel pain.

Lobsters can live for up to 50 years and the practice of boiling them alive is barbaric.
attributes.additional_details:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pain_in_crustaceans

"Opinion on the aspects of the biology and welfare of animals used for experimental and other scientific purposes". The EFSA Journal. European Food Safety Authority. 292: 1–46. 2005.

https://onekindplanet.org/uploads/publications/cephalopods-decapod-crustaceans.pdf

attributes.action: Make the A1 junction with the A46 at Newark in Nottinghamshire safe.
attributes.background:
The A1 at Newark is a very busy. 
There are regular fatal accidents on this section of the road. Specifically where the A1 meets the A46 and A17. Both slip roads on North and South are too short. The slip roads need to be longer or traffic lights putting on each roundabout either side.
attributes.additional_details: Our local MP has acknowledged this issue in the past but nothing seems to have been done as yet.

attributes.action: More investment for electrification after the statement about diesel trains.
attributes.background: Following the announcement by the government that there should be no purely diesel trains running after 2040 there should be a government plan with associated extra funding to electrify more of the rail network to help facilitate this goal.

attributes.action: Utilise Highways England to reconstruct our potholed minor roads.
attributes.background: I propose that we utilise the skills of Highways England to manage the reconstruction of our potholed and increasingly dangerous minor roads. Funding to be provided by reallocating some funds from the Strategic Road Network budget. We need to stop further deterioration of our roads and rebuild.
attributes.additional_details:
Highways England manages our Strategic Road Network that includes most motorways and significant ‘A’ roads. This covers only 2% of our total road network and yet accounts for a third of all travelled miles. However, £21.6 billion was spent on the SRN last year whilst only £1.8 billion was granted to the minor road network.

We need to temporarily redress this financial imbalance to rebuild our local roads to ensure that the ‘first and last mile’ of our journeys are improved to a safe standard.

attributes.action: Make students in the uk pay council tax in the city that they study and live.
attributes.background:
Students in Brighton and hove, that number in the thousands use all the resources that the residents use yet pay 0% council tax, this is wrong on every level, 
The residents are forced to pay increases year on year because resources are overused and  Underfinanced, students Must contribute.

attributes.action: Government to make the NHS independent legal entity free from political control
attributes.background: Over the last few years we have seen goverments of all political persuasions interfere in the work of the NHS resulting in it becoming a chaotic fire fighting organisation that does not have clear strategy to address it's future direction and challenges.

attributes.action: I would like the UK government to legally recognise polyamorous families.
attributes.background:
Polyamorous families in the UK are not given the same legal protections as monogamous couples who can marry or claim benefits as s cohabiting couple . 

Polyamorous people would like to be able to enter into legal marriage and be able to receive the same legal protections as other legal spouses.

attributes.action: Require MPs to hold regular constituency surgeries.
attributes.background: MPs currently have discretion about how frequently to hold constituency surgeries, or even whether to hold them at all.  This results in a discrepancy between levels of representation offered.  Some MPs go out of their way to exchange views with constituents, whereas others avoid doing so.
attributes.additional_details:
An obligation for MPs to hold constituency surgeries on a monthly (or other regular) basis would be beneficial to MPs and constituents alike.

Meeting with constituents is a key responsibility of the role of the MP (per: http://www.parliament.uk/about/mps-and-lords/members/mps/ for example)

attributes.action: Provide bereavement benefits for unmarried partners of 10 years or more.
attributes.background: Shawn and I were together for 26 years. He died on 31st March. It is unfair that bereavement allowances and payments are only for married couples and civil partners.
attributes.additional_details: People who are in a relationship for many years share the same costs and have the same financial responsibilities as married or civilly partnered people. They may have joint bank accounts and mortgages. They need the same rights to assistance when they lose their life partner.

attributes.action: Put an end to the breeding and hunting of ‘game’ birds.
attributes.background:
Breeding any animal solely for the purpose of killing it for fun is medieval. 

There are alternatives to keep the traditional British industry going such as target/clay pigeon shooting.

We want the government to make the breeding of and hunting for game illegal.

attributes.action: Raise Minimum Wage for Night Shift Workers.
attributes.background: Night shifts workers are regularly paid a premium on top of a companies normal wage but for many this is not the case. Since the introduction of the NMW (which was a good thing in general, though it does require some revisions) many night shift workers are now paid the national minimum wage.
attributes.additional_details: I propose that workers who work between the hours of midnight and six o'clock in the morning are paid a mandatory extra £2 per hour above the current national minimum wage.

attributes.action: Make public, communal eating space a legal requirement in high density housing.
attributes.background: A study found that regularly eating meals alone is the biggest single factor for unhappiness, besides existing mental illness. When we only design commercial spaces for individualised food consumption and cooking spaces for the single person, we are designing unhappiness.
attributes.additional_details:
We believe that it should be a legal requirement for housing developments of any significant density, to provide large social eating spaces and communal kitchens, in which inhabitants can cook for one another, socialise and share food freely. This will avoid public health concerns such as social isolation.
 
https://www.theguardian.com/society/2018/may/23/the-friend-effect-why-the-secret-of-health-and-happiness-is-surprisingly-simple
 
foodhallproject.org

attributes.action: Investigate the health impact of mobile technology on children and young people
attributes.background:
We call on the Government to examine the health impact of mobile technology on children & young people in reference to:

Sexting & Internet safety
Depression & Anxiety
General health
Sleep disorders
Technology addiction
 
Then commission an independent report
& act on its recommendations
attributes.additional_details:
Dr. Matthew M. Davis from University of Michigan Health System
https://www.eurekalert.org/pub_releases/2015-08/uomh-sai080715.php 

Smartphone Rehab article from the Independent
https://www.independent.co.uk/news/health/teenage-technology-addiction-smartphone-rehab-seattle-clinic-children-aged-13-mobile-devices-a7684356.html

Sonia Livingstone OBE Professor of Social Psychology (former head of dept at LSE)
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SyjbDUP1o0g&vl=en

Martin Blank PHD, Columbia University
https://vimeo.com/71864167

Dr. Devra Davis, Epidemiologist & Author (The Lancet, The Journal of the American Medical Association & The New York Times)
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8cJ6Il5fFg4

attributes.action: Make it law for all companies to plant three trees for every one they cut down.
attributes.background: Deforestation is happening at an unsustainable rate. Not only is it putting the survival of millions of species at risk but is also accelerating the effects of global warming. The best way to combat this is for every company trading in the UK to plant at least three trees for every one it cuts down.
attributes.additional_details:
"Many of the world’s most threatened and endangered animals live in forests, and 1.6 billion people rely on benefits forests offer, including food, fresh water, clothing, traditional medicine and shelter." "Some 46-58 thousand square miles of forest are lost each year—equivalent to 48 football fields every minute." https://www.worldwildlife.org/threats/deforestation#
"Deforestation is responsible for nearly 20 per cent of global carbon emissions." https://www.forestry.gov.uk/forestry/infd-7m8mnm

attributes.action: Ban the sale of Angora rabbit fur products in the UK
attributes.background: Angora rabbit fur is often harvested from live rabbits. Their legs are stretched and pinned down while their fur is ripped out leaving them to scream helplessly in pain. Its an inhumane and cruel practice that we must make a stand against.
attributes.additional_details: Britain should make a stand against and the Angora fur trade to demonstrate cruelly harvested products are not tolerated. The unethical practice of removal of rabbit fur in China has recently been highlighted by People for the Unethical Treatment of Animals (PETA.) Their graphic evidence is featured on their website. The rabbits are kept in disgusting conditions and subjected to abuse that is beyond words.

attributes.action: Make The PSA Test for Prostrate Cancer compulsory for men over 40.
attributes.background:
Prostrate cancer is a treatable disease, like most the earlier the better.
There is a simple test that can indicate whether someone is at risk but it is not freely offered unless recommended by a GP.
This should be given the same level of awareness as Breast Cancer is for women but it is not.
attributes.additional_details:
The chances of being affected by prostrate cancer increases with age, but can affect men who are 40+.
Men don't talk about their problems, so we can continue boldly on fearing the worst because of the rectal examination when in fact men do not know that The PSA Test is available through a simple blood test.
This should be a part of the blood test - it would remove the need for repeat appointments with The NHS and therefore actually save both time and money in catching this before its too late.

attributes.action: Ban the production and use of plastic rings as packaging material
attributes.background: Plastic rings are currently being used to hold drinking cans together. Animals are getting caught up in the plastic rings and need to either live handicapped with them or die dreadfully. Single cans can be put into shopping bags. There is no need to harm animals and the environment.

attributes.action: Place limits on the amount of carbon that polluters are allowed to emit
attributes.background: Help reduce the amount of carbon being released into the atmosphere to aid the prevention of global warming

attributes.action: Theresa May. NO bridge or new infrastructure to be built between UK and France
attributes.background: We sadly have the channel tunnel which people can still walk through. We the public do not want anymore tax payers money being spent on infrastructure, that joins us to france.We're an island and want to keep it that way for OUR safety.
attributes.additional_details: Boris Johnson on Thursday January 18th 2018 said he wants to now build a bridge to join the uk to france

attributes.action: Fund bus passes for 16 to 18 years olds who are still in full time education
attributes.background: Why does the government insists that our children stay in education until they are 18 but will not fund the transportation to get to sixth form or college after they leave school at 16.

attributes.action: Make 29th March a National Bank Holiday - Called Independence Day!
attributes.background: On the 29th March the UK will officially leave the European Union - This should be celebrated nationally with a bank holiday.
attributes.additional_details: After many decades being controlled through multiple European Union institutions, being unable to control our own trading policy, immigration system, waters and laws. On the 23rd June 2016, the United Kingdom voted to become a self governing country again - This will finally start to happen on March 29th 2019 - And it should therefore be celebrated.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for school toilets to have no soap, toilet paper, or locks
attributes.background: Currently I don’t believe it is illegal for schools to have insufficient hygiene standards in toilets. Many students avoid using toilets during school which can cause further health complications including kidney infections. This also encourages smoking, bullying, and vandalism.

attributes.action: Introduce a reassuring EM radiation limit for homes and schools (eg 1,000 µW/m2)
attributes.background:
There is no specific limit for mobile phone radiation in homes. We use the out-dated 1998 ICNIRP recommendation for incidental public exposure, which includes no risk management. 

Badly sited masts result in unnecessarily high levels which are never turned off and the health impact is unknown.
attributes.additional_details:
The World Health Organisation continues to rate this type of radiation as a Class 2b Carcinogen and many studies link it to childhood lukemia and other illnesses. Sufferers of electrosensitivity are also becoming increasingly common.

A phone network continues to work at 0.000002µW/m2 (source: powerwatch.org.uk). Before it stopped auditing it, over 10 years ago, the highest level Ofcom recorded inside a residence was 790µW/m2. Other countries have sensible limits without affecting reception.

attributes.action: Introduce prostate cancer screening
attributes.background: There are often no symptoms of prostate cancer until it has spread and its too late to cure. Many lives could be saved and it would save the NHS a fortune in expensive treatments.
